type: Supply of Four (4) CO2 Cell Culture Incubators
short_summary: Provision of four CO2 cell culture incubators
description: This requirement has been put in place by Health Canada, to meet the need for Laboratory and Scientific Equipment, Parts and Accessories, Services and Supplies. The procurement methodology is competitive and is based on the lowest price.
full_summary:
**Supply of Four (4) CO2 Cell Culture Incubators**
==============================================

**Tender Information**

* **Reference Number:** 1000252794
* **Solicitation Number:** 1000252794
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-10-04T14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 2023-10-10
* **Expected Contract End Date:** 2024-03-31

**Supply Arrangement**

This tender is reserved for holders of the Supply Arrangement #E60PV-19EQUI only, for the purchase of laboratory and scientific equipment, parts and accessories, services, and supplies.

**Evaluation Criteria**

The selection criteria for this tender are:

* Lowest Price
* Mandatory technical criteria

**Tender Description**

Health Canada is seeking bids for the supply of four (4) CO2 cell culture incubators. The Contractor must meet the mandatory technical criteria and have the lowest aggregate price to be recommended for contract award.

Suppliers that do not have a Supply Arrangement for the supply of Laboratory and Scientific Equipment, Parts and Accessories, Services, and Supplies with Public Works and Government Services Canada cannot submit a bid.

**Contact Information**

For any inquiries or to request a copy of the solicitation document, please contact:

* **Eryn Mathers**, Contracting Officer
* **Email:** [eryn.mathers@hc-sc.gc.ca](mailto:eryn.mathers@hc-sc.gc.ca)
* **Phone:** 613-298-2804
* **Address:** 200 Eglantine Dr, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0K9

**Notice URL**

The solicitation documents can be downloaded from CanadaBuys (SAP Ariba).

**Trade Agreements**

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Regions of Delivery**

The contract will be delivered throughout the National Capital Region (NCR).

JDF Writers Handbook is recommended for guidance in achieving a perfect page layout. | [read ](https://www.ats.gov.bc.ca/its/its/intranet/index.cfm?name=spec_jcf06_jdf/index.htm) | [read](https://www.documentation.gov/jdf/reference)

**Regions of Opportunity**

None.
